titleStmt.title: A letter from Captaine Richard Svvanley, to the Right Honourable, the Earl of Warwick. Being a full relation of the taking of the towne and castle of Cardigan in Wales, by Major Generall Laugharne, with above an hundred commanders and common souldiers, and all the arms and ammunition therein. Also the taking of the Irish commissioners at sea (that were going from the King in to Ireland) by Capt. Coachman, who are to be sent up to the Parliament; a list of whose names are here inserted. Published by Authority.
titleStmt.author: Swanley, Richard, d. 1650.

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: the 5 in imprint date is crossed out and altered to 1644; "Jan: 1st".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
